page.title: 04THE FIRE BRIGADE
page.content: THE BILLINGHAY FIRE BRIGADE HAS ONE FIRE ENGINE.THERE ARE TEN PART TIME FIRE MEN.SOME ARE CALLED OUT BY A SPECIAL BLEEPER OR BY THE TELEPHONE.THE FIRE STATION IS IN CHURCH STREET AND WAS OPENED OFFICIALLY IN 1964 THEY HAVE CERTAIN ITEMS OF SPECIAL EQUIPMENT FOR FIRE FIGHTING.THE WORST FIRE THAT THEY HAD TO DEAL WITH WAS SCOTTS FARM IN RUSKINGTON FEN IN 1984.THEY HAVE SPECIAL BREATHING APPARATUS AND SPECIAL SAWS TO GET TRAPPED PEOPLE OUT OF THEIR CARS.THEY ALSO HAVE FOAM TO SPRAY ON PETROL FIRES.THE BILLINGHAY FIREMEN GO AS FAR AS DIGBY,ANWICK,CONINGSBY AND TIMBERLAND.THEY NEED SIX NIGHTS TRAINING AND THEN THE TEST.THEY GET CALLED OUT ON AVERAGE ONCE A WEEK.THE FIREMAN I INTERVIEWED HAD BEEN IN 18 MONTHS.
